answers.answer: A child's well-being and immunity depend on continued breastfeeding or eating a balanced diet.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'Childrenâ€™s nutrition'.

answers.answer: Breast milk strengthens the child's immunity, which can be weakened in conditions of anxiety and stress, thus providing full protection for the child's health.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'Why it is especially important to continue breastfeeding in an emergency'.

answers.answer: Stressful situations do not affect milk production or quality, but stress may rarely slow down the flow of milk.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'Breastfeeding'.

answers.answer: Frequent attachment of the baby to the breast ensures adequate milk production, with experts recommending feeding on demand, at least 8-12 times a day.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'Breastfeeding'.

answers.answer: In an emergency, direct physical contact during breastfeeding helps the child feel safe, and hormones produced enhance the mother's sense of peace and security.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'Why it is especially important to continue breastfeeding in an emergency'.

answers.answer: To maintain lactation if the baby is temporarily not with her, a mother should continue to drain milk with her hands or a breast pump, following the usual number of feedings.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'What if your baby can't breastfed or he is not with you'.

answers.answer: To restore milk supply, a mother should try to restore the usual return of milk, put the baby to the breast often, drink more water, massage the neck, get enough rest, take a warm shower, and eat well.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'What to do if you cannot continue breastfeeding'.

answers.answer: The Support for refugee women program can guide mothers facing breastfeeding difficulties towards counselling and prenatal education services in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'Difficulties with breastfeeding?'.

answers.answer: For babies under six months, ready-to-use commercial or generic infant formula suitable for their age is recommended, while animal milk, water, or formula for older children should be avoided.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'If you can not restore lactation'.

answers.answer: To prepare dry infant formula safely, boil water above 70 degrees Celsius to kill bacteria, and do not prepare the formula in advance.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'If you can not restore lactation'.

answers.answer: When feeding formula, especially while traveling, it is recommended to use a cup instead of bottles because it is easier to clean and dirty bottles can cause illness.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'If you can not restore lactation'.

answers.answer: Children older than six months can be fed animal milk (cow's or goat's, including ultra-pasteurized) and complementary foods.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'If you can not restore lactation'.

answers.answer: Clean drinking water should be stored in closed containers, and if stored for a long time, it should be disinfected.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'Water'.

answers.answer: Recommended ready-to-eat foods for an emergency stock include bread, cookies, crackers, canned foods, nuts, seeds, dried fruits, chocolate, energy bars, fruits, instant cereals, and ready meals like mashed meat, fish, or vegetables.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'Food on the go'.

answers.answer: Refugee pregnant women and mothers can access support by calling +40725278273 for phone assistance or to schedule a free online consultation with a consultant from the Romanian Association of Consultants in Lactation or the Association of Independent Midwives.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'IMPORTANT'.

answers.answer: Telemedicine consultations for breastfeeding support may be held in English or with translation in Ukrainian.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'IMPORTANT'.

answers.answer: More helpful information about breastfeeding, women's health, and reproductive health services can be found on the Women Center platform.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'More helpful information about breastfeeding'.
